Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in failing to consider perception of applicant as Christian due to Chaldean identity
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found not credible due to multiple falsehoods
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Lack of evidence that Chaldeans are readily identified as Christians in Iraq
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97 or 98 of IRPA (risk of persecution)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of religious persecution based on perceived Christian identity
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credibility and insufficient evidence linking Chaldean identity to perceived Christianity
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to establish subjective or objective basis for fear
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No error found by the Board
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Board must analyze risk factors raised by evidence, but not required to raise new arguments
Crimes.Application_Factor: Perceived religious identity in country of origin
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Alleged failure to consider relevant risk factor
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Article 1A(2) of the Refugee Convention; IRPA s. 96-98
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and insufficient evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of evidence supporting perception of Chaldeans as Christians in Iraq
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Board fulfilled duty to consider submitted arguments
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that Board failed to consider identity-based persecution risk
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of Board's obligation to analyze unproven perceptions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to substantiate claim with evidence
